intro: Vanda merrillii var. immaculata, commonly known as the immaculate vanda, is a member of the Orchidaceae family native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic orchid that thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing on trees or rocks. The plant features long, strap-like leaves and produces striking, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. It is prized for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for with proper light and humidity. This variety is known for its compact growth and ability to bloom multiple times a year.
